title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Civic Nation
Interview Descriptions: Really great interview! They ask very good, value-based questions. Kind and welcoming as well. They give the space for you to express yourself and they want to hear about who you are.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with Civic Nation?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Civic Nation (Detroit, MI) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very explicit in the expectations of the role and extremely receptive to questions throughout the interview process. A very communicative experience that was respectful of my time and accommodated for me as needed given that this all took place remotely.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working with students?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Civic Nation
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved a phone interview a second phone interview with a lobbyist in Boston, and a lengthy 3rd-round interview in person with three elements: a presentation, a team discussion, and a final CEO private interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were standard. What was not standard was the fact that both the CEO and the lobbyist invested a lot of time in undermining and bad-mouthing the director, the person that became my direct supervisor. I was privately told that my director: a) couldn't fundraise b) told funders information she shouldn't b) rubbed funders the wrong way c) had embarrassed the organization in front of funders on several occasions d) I was told stories about my director that detailed some of those embarrassing incidents.
